blocks.name: infmrgelbi
blocks.content: Any lower bound of a nonempty set of real numbers is less than or equal to its infimum, one-direction version. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Sep-2013.) (Revised by AV, 17-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm infmrgelbi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0)))), wbr(c1, cle, cinf(c0, cr, clt)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpbird(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0)))), wbr(c1, cle, cinf(c0, cr, clt)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  simpr(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  syl31anc(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0)))), wb(wbr(c1, cle, cinf(c0, cr, clt)), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0)))), wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(hs0, cr, wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)))), wcel(c1, cr))
  simpl1(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  simpl2(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  3ad2antl3(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))), wrex(hs0, cr, wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)))))
  rspcev(hs0, c1, cr, wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0))))
  ralbidv(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, cle, cv(s0))
  simpl3(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cr), wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  infregelb(hs0, s0, s0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.w(wral(s0, c0, wbr(c1, cle, cv(s0))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

thm infmrgelbi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))→ c1[≤]inf(c0, ℝ, <))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpbird(((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0)), c1[≤]inf(c0, ℝ, <), ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  simpr((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  syl31anc(((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0)), (c1[≤]inf(c0, ℝ, <)↔ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0)), c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, ∃(hs0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]s0)), c1 ∈ ℝ)
  simpl1(c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, c1 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  simpl2(c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, c1 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  3ad2antl3(c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, c1 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0), ∃(hs0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]s0)))
  rspcev(hs0, c1, cr, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0), ∀(s0 ∈ c0, hs0[≤]s0))
  ralbidv(s0, c0, hs0 = c1, hs0[≤]s0, c1[≤]s0)
  breq1(hs0, c1, cle, s0)
  simpl3(c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, c1 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  infregelb(hs0, s0, s0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s0 ∈ c0, c1[≤]s0))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: pellfundglb
blocks.content: If a real is larger than the fundamental solution, there is a nontrivial solution less than it. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: pellfundex
blocks.content: The fundamental solution as an infimum is itself a solution, showing that the solution set is discrete. Since the fundamental solution is an infimum, there must be an element ge to Fund and lt 2*Fund. If this element is equal to the fundamental solution we're done, otherwise use the infimum again to find another element which must be ge Fund and lt the first element; their ratio is a group element in (1,2), contradicting ~ pell14qrgapw . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Sep-2014.)
